about_the_game:
Million dollars per kilometer is a survival runner with a grim dystopian atmosphere.

Immerse yourself in a dangerous action adventure in pursuit of wealth and fame. Overcome a variety of unique locations, encountering various obstacles, extreme weather conditions, deadly challenges, wild animals, dangerous robots and terrifying monsters.

In the game you have to become a participant of a crazy reality show, the main condition of which is to advance inside a huge structure, earning a million dollars for each kilometer traveled.

The Life Line, a megastructure consisting of two high walls, stretches for dozens of kilometers along a lifeless desert. It was once conceived as an ambitious architectural project, a large city capable of housing 9 million inhabitants in one building. But in the end, unfinished, the project became an arena for brutal survival games.

Inside, between the walls, there are many different challenges and dangers, passing which the players replenish their prize pool. They will be able to collect the money earned by traveling the entire distance along "The Life Line”. Participation is strictly voluntary, and everything that happens in the show is broadcast live around the world. You are one of the first contestants to qualify, and here's what you need to know before you start your game:

The Time Wall — is a red holographic wall that follows the player perpendicular to "The Life Line”.

The player has a yellow shock collar around his neck. If "The Time Wall" comes into contact with the collar, the player will die. The Time Wall doesn't move very fast, you can easily avoid it by speeding up your run. But do not hesitate, it is dangerous to stand in one place for a long time.

Inside "The Life Line”, you are not restricted in movement, you can move forward on any path you like. The distance between the walls is not small. Look around, explore the locations, and decide how you're going to do the next challenge, where to run, and where to look for the right path. Options for passing can often be more than one.

Do not forget to keep an eye on the scale of health, stamina, and various hazards such as frostbite, acid burn, and radiation poisoning rates.

Beds — you can find it on your way, they serve as a save point for the gameplay.

Boxes — they are also found on your way in various places. There is always something useful in it: clothes, weapons, and anything else you might need. That is why a thorough exploring of the locations, although time-consuming, can be extremely advantageous.

The shop is a rather conspicuous place sometimes encountered along the way. Here you can buy everything and more with money from your collected prize money.

If you need something — you're welcome.

Inventory:

Once you find your backpack, you will have access to a small inventory with which you can stockpiling and conveniently use useful items.

Transportation:

Walking — is not the only way to cover distance in the game.

Transportation is available to you for more convenience.

Car — you can find it at locations or buy it in the shop.

With its help you can easily and quickly overcome long distances. But only if you do not encounter any serious obstacles on your way.

A train is a safe and reliable means of transportation, although not as versatile as a car. On a train, you are protected from external dangers and have time to take a break. While it autonomously travels the distance, you can look around inside, look for boxes of supplies, or even find a shop.

name: Million dollars per kilometer

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: WINDOWS® 7, 8.1, 10 (64bit)
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-3470 (3.2 GHz) / AMD A8-7600 (3.1 GHz)
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 750 Ti / AMD Radeon R7 265
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 10 GB available space

short_description: Survival runner with a grim dystopian atmosphere. You have to become a participant of a crazy reality show. Overcome a variety of unique locations, encountering deadly challenges, extreme weather conditions, wild animals, dangerous robots and terrifying monsters.
supported_languages:
English*, Simplified Chinese, Russian, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Korean, Polish, Ukrainian, Japanese
*languages with full audio support
